title: How to Make Tomato and Cumin Soup

steps.headline: Fry the onion and garlic gently in a heavy-based saucepan.
steps.description: Only fry until soft; avoid browning them.

steps.headline: Add the tomatoes, carrot, tomato paste, cumin, coriander, stock, turmeric and water to the pan.
Turn up the heat until the soup mix boils and then turn down to simmer.
Remove the soup from the heat and puree.
steps.description: You can puree using a masher by hand, or with an electric wand blender. If you don't have a  wand blender, and use a bench-top blender, you will need to let the soup cool to a warm temperature first; be careful not to fill to the top (the lid can blow off when too much warm liquid is there) and do not blend hot liquid.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add a dollop of yogurt (if using) and serve with crusty bread and some salad on a side plate.

text: Fry the onion and garlic gently in a heavy-based saucepan. Only fry until soft; avoid browning them. Add the tomatoes, carrot, tomato paste, cumin, coriander, stock, turmeric and water to the pan.  Turn up the heat until the soup mix boils and then turn down to simmer. Leave to simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the soup from the heat and puree. You can puree using a masher by hand, or with an electric wand blender. If you don't have a  wand blender, and use a bench-top blender, you will need to let the soup cool to a warm temperature first; be careful not to fill to the top (the lid can blow off when too much warm liquid is there) and do not blend hot liquid. Serve. Add a dollop of yogurt (if using) and serve with crusty bread and some salad on a side plate. Finished.
